intro: Galium nuttallii subsp. tenue, commonly known as slender bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial herb native to North America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces tiny white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its hairy stems and leaves are adapted to retain moisture in its preferred habitat.
